title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 March 2012 - XWiki
content:
04:15 <DrLou\_> has quit  
05:03 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <Denis> has quit  
06:21 <tekzilla> has quit  
06:26 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r8928740 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/8928740cd87cc675deea2b9a5ee5041c6e90c28d / xwiki-rendering-transformations/xwiki-rendering-transformation-linkchecker/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/transformation/linkchecker/LinkCheckerScriptService.java : Typo - http://git.io/5MJfPg  
11:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <polx> @arpitgyl, use the mailing-list.  
11:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <pulasthi> has quit  
11:12 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <@cjd> hey pulasthi, how's it going?  
11:38 <pulasthi> cjd : hi  
11:39 <@cjd> I've been working on the cassandra stuff some more, I'm really close to having something to show off again.  
11:40 <pulasthi> cjd: i am doing fine, i didn't have a lot of free time so wasn't able to come around  
11:40 <@cjd> yeah, that's fine  
11:40 <pulasthi> cjd : ahh nice to hear :)  
11:40 <@cjd> I went through and changed the schema so we can search inside of objects with jdo/jpa queries  
11:40 <@cjd> and everything is now in one big table since cassandra supports that  
11:41 <@cjd> and I upgraded to cassandra 1.0.6 and the bug that prevented it from running in the same jvm process as xwiki is fixed  
11:41 <pulasthi> ahh so was my improvement for DN plugin useful :)  
11:41 <@cjd> indeed it has been.  
11:43 <@cjd> I'm thinking that one thing that might come out of this in the longish term is a "cloud service development kit" where you can just fire one of these things up and have a databasey thing with a webserver in front of it.  
11:43 <@cjd> and obviously just fire up more of them and have more database/webserver nodes  
11:43 <pulasthi> cool  
11:44 <pulasthi> these days i am writing a clustering implementation with Zookeeper with 3 other friends for my final year project :)  
11:45 <@cjd> nice  
11:45 <@cjd> https://github.com/cjdelisle/cjdns <-- this is my free time project  
11:46 <pulasthi> cool :)  
11:46 <pulasthi> btw  i took a look at the ideas page for GSoC 2012.  
11:47 <pulasthi> hoping to apply this year also  
11:48 <@cjd> Cool, I hope you get sponsored. You took on a hard project and made good progress, it was unfortunate that the project didn't have a good definition of success. You definitely stuck with it and made good code though.  
11:49 <pulasthi> thanks  
11:50 <pulasthi> im also applying to apache since its related to my final year project. but my initial GSoC idea overlaps another idea so may have come up with a new one  
11:51 <pulasthi> if i find an interesting on at Xwiki ill give it a try also :)  
11:51 <@cjd> which apache project?  
11:51 <pulasthi> Axis2  
11:52 <pulasthi> over clustering implementation is also for Axis2  
11:52 <@cjd> ahh I don't know it..  some apache stuff is done well and some apache stuff makes me cry  
11:52 <pulasthi> Axis2 has a neat code and some great devs  
11:52 <@cjd> cool  
11:54 <pulasthi> I'll keep in touch have to go now  
11:54 <@cjd> see ya  
11:54 <pulasthi> see ya  
11:54 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki
